amendments.title: An amendment No. 34 printed in House Report 114-623 to prohibit funds for any salaries or expenses for the offices of the Special Envoy for Guantanamo Detention Closure or the Principal Director, Detainee Policy.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the DeSantis amendment (A033) Agreed to by recorded vote: 226 - 194 (Roll no. 324). (consideration: CR H3947)

amendments.title: An amendment No. 33 printed in House Report 114-623 to prohibit Overseas Contingency Operation funds found in Title IX from being used for anything other than a Contingency Operation as defined by United States Code.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Mulvaney amendment (A032) Failed by recorded vote: 112 - 306 (Roll no. 323). (consideration: CR H3946-3947)

amendments.title: An amendment No. 32 printed in House Report 114-623 to prohibit the Department of Defense from obligating or expending funds on certain green energy mandates found in various provisions of US Code and two Executive Orders.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the McClintock amendment (A031) Agreed to by recorded vote: 221 - 197 (Roll no. 322). (consideration: CR H3945-3946)

amendments.title: An amendment No. 31 printed in House Report 114-623 to prohibit warrantless searches of government databases for the communications of U.S. persons and prohibits government agencies from mandating data security vulnerabilities in products or services for surveillance purposes.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Massie amendment (A030) Failed by recorded vote: 198 - 222 (Roll no. 321). (consideration: CR H3945)

amendments.title: An amendent No. 30 printed in House Report 114-623 to block funding for DOD drug interdiction and counter-drug activities in Afghanistan.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Massie amendment (A029) Failed by recorded vote: 48 - 372 (Roll no. 320). (consideration: CR H3944-3945)

amendments.title: An amendment numbered 29 printed in House Report 114-623 to prohibit the use of funds to survey, assess, or review potential detention locations in the United States to detain any individual presently detained at United States Naval Station, Guantanamo Bay, Cuba.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Lamborn amendment (A028) Agreed to by recorded vote: 245 - 175 (Roll no. 319). (consideration: CR H3943-3944)

amendments.title: An amendment numbered 28 printed in House Report 114-623 to state no funds in this act may be used to transfer a detainee at Guantanamo Bay to any other location.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Hudson amendment (A027) Agreed to by voice vote.

amendments.title: An amendment numbered 27 printed in House Report 114-623 to ensure no funds are used by the Department of Defense to enlist DACA youth in the United States military.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the King (IA) amendment (A026) Failed by recorded vote: 207 - 214 (Roll no. 318). (consideration: CR H3943)

amendments.title: An amendment numbered 26 printed in House Report 114-623 to prohibit funds from being used by this Act to enlist DACA aliens in the military, who are currently only considered eligible through the MAVNI program as a result of a September 2014 memo from the administration.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Gosar amendment (A025) Failed by recorded vote: 210 - 211 (Roll no. 317). (consideration: CR H3942-3943)

amendments.title: An amendment numbered 25 printed in House Report 114-623 to ensure no funds are used by the Department of Defense to carry out or in response to the memorandum of the Deputy Assistant Secretary of Defense for Homeland Defense Integration and Defense Support of Civil Authorities titled Memorandum for Secretaries of the Military Departments Director, Joint Staff and dated November 25, 2015.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the King (IA) amendment (A024) Agreed to by recorded vote: 221 - 200 (Roll no. 316). (consideration: CR H3941-3942)
Senate amendment submitted

amendments.title: An amendment numbered 24 printed in House Report 114-623 to prohibit funds to be used to modify a military installation in the United States, including construction or modification of a facility on a military installation, to provide temporary housing for unaccompanied alien children.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Byrne amendment (A023) Agreed to by recorded vote: 223 - 198 (Roll no. 315). (consideration: CR H3941)

amendments.title: An amendment numbered 23 printed in House Report 114-623 to prevent DOD from partnering with private organizations to create or expand national heritage asset areas in southeast Colorado.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Buck amendment (A022) Agreed to by voice vote.

amendments.title: An amendment numbered 22 printed in House Report 114-623 to prohibit funds to implement Department of Defense (DOD) Directive 4715.21 on Climate Change Adaption and Resilience, requiring the Pentagon to prioritize climate change over national security.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Buck amendment (A021) Agreed to by recorded vote: 216 - 205 (Roll no. 314). (consideration: CR H3940-3941)

amendments.title: An amendment numbered 21 printed in House Report 114-623 to ensure that the Department of Defense retains its statutory authority to provide new military recruits a small cash voucher that they can use to purchase running shoes for training.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Sanford amendment (A020) Failed by recorded vote: 155 - 265 (Roll no. 313). (consideration: CR H3940)
Senate amendment submitted

amendments.title: An amendment numbered 20 printed in House Report 114-623 to reduce the funding level for the Afghanistan Security Forces Fund of $3,448,715,000 by $448,715,000 to $3,000,000,000 and transfers that money for deficit reduction.
amendments.latest_major_action: By unanimous consent, the Duncan (TN) amendment was withdrawn. (consideration: CR H3883)

amendments.title: An amendment numbered 19 printed in House Report 114-623 to cut funding to Pakistan from $900 million to $700 million.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Poe (TX) amendment (A018) Failed by recorded vote: 191 - 230 (Roll no. 312). (consideration: CR H3939-3940)

amendments.title: An amendment numbered 18 printed in House Report 114-623 to strike the prohibition of funds to enforce section 526 that restricts Federal Agencies from entering into contracts to buy alternative fuels that are more polluting than conventional fuels.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Peters amendment (A017) Failed by voice vote.

amendments.title: An amendment numbered 17 printed in House Report 114-623 to strike a provision of the bill requiring the Air Force to utilize specific energy sourced domestically within the United States as the base load energy for heating at U.S. defense installations in Kaiserslautern, Germany.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Huffman amendment (A016) Agreed to by recorded vote: 268 - 153 (Roll no. 311). (consideration: CR H3938-3939)
